title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel that explores themes of racial injustice, moral growth, and compassion in the American Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime and the struggle for truth and freedom in a controlled society.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho but eventually escapes to learn about the wider world through education.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tale of love, wealth, and the American Dream set during the Roaring Twenties.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story following the experiences of a young man in New York City after being expelled from prep school.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores a future society where scientific and technological advancements have changed the fabric of human life.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The diary of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis in Amsterdam during World War II, providing a poignant account of her experiences.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure novel following Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on a journey to help a group of Dwarves regain their homeland from a fearsome dragon.
